availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
The State of Ky.
County of Jefferson

This day A. J. McAlten made oath before me a Justice of the Peace for Said County that on the 29th day of Nov. 1862. in the County of Daviess in Said State "Elliott" a slave the property of Willis Field of the Said County of Daviess in the State of Ky. did maliciously & with malice aforethought with a butcher knife about six inches long which he the Said Elliott Slave as aforesaid then held in his left hand Stab, thrust and penetrated the body of the Said Willis Field in the abdomen & through the heart of the Said Willis Field, then & there after being stabed as afsd by the Said Elliott slave as aforesaid with the Butcher Knife six inches long as afsd lingered & Died from the effects of the Stabbing as afsd by the Said Elliott Slave as afsd & that this Said Elliott, slave of Willis Field as afsd is guilty of the Crime of "Murder" in the killing & murdering the Said Willis Field
in Daviss County in the State of Ky. as afsd & that the Said Elliott is now a Fugitive from Justice in the State of Indiana, going at large
Subscribed & sworn to before me by Alexius J. McAtee this 21 day of Feb 1863.
Jos Clement J. P. J. C.

State of Ky.
Jefferson Co } Sct.

I, T. Jack Conn Clerk clerk of the County Court of the County afsd certify that Jos Clement whose genuine signature appears to the foregoing certificate is now and was at the time of Signing the Same an acting Justice of the Peace in and for Said Co duly elected & qualified & that full faith & Credit are due all his official acts as such.
In Testimony whereof I have herewith set my hand & affixed the Seal of said court this 24. Feby 1863

State of Ky
Jeff. Co. } To wit

I, Andrew Monroe Sole Judge of this Jefferson County Court to certify that T. Jack Conn whose genuine Signature appears to the foregoing certificate is and was at the time of making the same Clerk of the Jefferson County Court duly elected and issued & qualified & that full credit are due to his official acts as such.
Witness my hand this 24th day of Feby 1863.

Andrew Monroe
Sole Judge Jeff. Co. Ct

Indiana
Requisition for Elliott (a Slave)
Murder
R Gilchrist
Agent
Issd Mar 4th 1863
